class.name: Word.ShapeTextWrap
class.description: Represents all the properties for wrapping text around a shape.

properties.name: bottomDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the document text and the bottom edge of the text-free area surrounding the specified shape.

examples.description: Set the bottom distance to 20 points between the document text and a shape's text-free area

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a shape's text wrap object to verify the connection to the Word host application before modifying wrap properties.

properties.name: leftDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the document text and the left edge of the text-free area surrounding the specified shape.

examples.description: Set the left distance to 20 points between the document text and a shape's text-free area

properties.name: rightDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the document text and the right edge of the text-free area surrounding the specified shape.

examples.description: Set the right distance to 20 points between the document text and a shape's right edge to create proper spacing

properties.name: side
properties.description: Specifies whether the document text should wrap on both sides of the specified shape, on either the left or right side only, or on the side of the shape that's farthest from the page margin.

examples.description: Set a shape's text wrapping to wrap on both sides of the shape

properties.name: topDistance
properties.description: Specifies the distance (in points) between the document text and the top edge of the text-free area surrounding the specified shape.

examples.description: Set the top distance to 20 points between the document text and a shape's text-free area

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies the text wrap type around the shape. See `Word.ShapeTextWrapType` for details.

examples.description: Set the text wrap type of a shape to "Square" so that text flows around the shape in a square pattern.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and read the text wrapping type of the first shape in the document

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Configure text wrapping settings for a shape to wrap text on both sides with specific distance margins

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.ShapeTextWrap` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.ShapeTextWrapData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the text wrapping properties of a shape as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console for debugging or serialization purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a shape's text wrap object across multiple sync calls to monitor and adjust wrap properties without encountering InvalidObjectPath errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Access a shape's text wrapping properties, use them to check the wrapping type, then untrack the object to free memory
